JavaDoq: Assert.java   
001 package de.general.util;
002 
003 /**
004  *
005  * @author knauth
006  */
007 public class Assert
008 {
009 
010     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
011     // Constants
012     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
013 
014     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
015     // Variables
016     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
017 
018     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
019     // Constructors
020     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
021 
022     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
023     // Methods
024     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
025 
026     public static void assertEquals(String str, double obj1, double obj2, double delta)
027     {
028         if (obj1 == obj2) {
029             return;
030         } else
031         if (Math.abs(obj1 - obj2) <= delta) {
032             return;
033         } else {
034             fail(str + " expected=" + obj1 + " actual=" + obj2 + " delta=" + delta);
035         }
036     }
037 
038     public static void assertEquals(String str, float obj1, float obj2, float delta)
039     {
040         if (obj1 == obj2) {
041             return;
042         } else
043         if (Math.abs(obj1 - obj2) <= delta) {
044             return;
045         } else {
046             fail(str + " expected=" + obj1 + " actual=" + obj2 + " delta=" + delta);
047         }
048     }
049 
050     public static void assertEquals(String msg, int expected, int actual)
051     {
052         if (expected != actual) {
053             fail(msg + " expected=" + expected + " actual=" + actual);
054         }
055     }
056 
057     public static void assertEquals(String msg, Object obj1, Object obj2)
058     {
059         if (obj1 == null && obj2 == null) {
060             return;
061         }
062 
063         if ((obj1 != null) && (obj2 != null) && obj1.equals(obj2)) {
064             return;
065         }
066 
067         fail(msg + " expected=" + obj1 + " actual=" + obj2);
068     }
069 
070     public static void assertEquals(boolean obj1, boolean obj2)
071     {
072         assertEquals("", obj1, obj2);
073     }
074 
075     public static void assertEquals(byte obj1, byte obj2)
076     {
077         assertEquals("", obj1, obj2);
078     }
079 
080     public static void assertEquals(char obj1, char obj2)
081     {
082         assertEquals("", obj1, obj2);
083     }
084 
085     public static void assertEquals(double obj1, double obj2)
086     {
087         assertEquals("", obj1, obj2);
088     }
089 
090     public static void assertEquals(float obj1, float obj2)
091     {
092         assertEquals("", obj1, obj2);
093     }
094 
095     public static void assertEquals(short obj1, short obj2)
096     {
097         assertEquals("", obj1, obj2);
098     }
099 
100     public static void assertEquals(int obj1, int obj2)
101     {
102         assertEquals("", obj1, obj2);
103     }
104 
105     public static void assertEquals(long obj1, long obj2)
106     {
107         assertEquals("", obj1, obj2);
108     }
109 
110     public static void assertEquals(Object obj1, Object obj2)
111     {
112         assertEquals("", obj1, obj2);
113     }
114 
115     public static void assertEquals(String msg, boolean obj1, boolean obj2)
116     {
117         assertEquals(msg, obj1, obj2);
118     }
119 
120     public static void assertEquals(String msg, byte obj1, byte obj2)
121     {
122         assertEquals(msg, obj1, obj2);
123     }
124 
125     public static void assertEquals(String msg, char obj1, char obj2)
126     {
127         assertEquals(msg, obj1, obj2);
128     }
129 
130     public static void assertFalse(boolean condition)
131     {
132         assertFalse(null, condition);
133     }
134 
135     public static void assertFalse(String message, boolean condition)
136     {
137         assertTrue(message, !condition);
138     }
139 
140     public static void assertNotNull(Object obj)
141     {
142         assertNotNull(null, obj);
143     }
144 
145     public static void assertNotNull(String msg, Object obj)
146     {
147         assertTrue(msg, obj != null);
148     }
149 
150     public static void assertNotSame(Object obj1, Object obj2)
151     {
152         assertNotSame(null, obj1, obj2);
153     }
154 
155     public static void assertNotSame(String msg, Object obj1, Object obj2)
156     {
157         if (obj1 != obj2) {
158             return;
159         }
160 
161         if (msg == null) {
162             msg = "";
163         }
164 
165         fail(msg + " expected and actual match");
166     }
167 
168     public static void assertNull(Object obj)
169     {
170         assertNull(null, obj);
171     }
172 
173     public static void assertNull(String msg, Object obj)
174     {
175         assertTrue(msg, obj == null);
176     }
177 
178     public static void assertSame(Object obj1, Object obj2)
179     {
180         assertSame(null, obj1, obj2);
181     }
182 
183     public static void assertSame(String msg, Object obj1, Object obj2)
184     {
185         if (obj1 == obj2) {
186             return;
187         }
188 
189         if (msg == null) {
190             msg = "";
191         }
192 
193         fail(msg + " expected and actual do not match");
194     }
195 
196     public static void assertTrue(boolean condition)
197     {
198         assertTrue(null, condition);
199     }
200 
201     public static void assertTrue(String message, boolean condition)
202     {
203         if (!condition) {
204             fail(message);
205         }
206     }
207 
208     public static void fail()
209     {
210         fail(null);
211     }
212 
213     public static void fail(String message)
214     {
215         throw new AssertionFailedError(message);
216     }
217 
218 }
  JavaDoq: Assert.java
